By Eagle_Fierce on Friday, September 1, 2000 - 12:28 pm:

Tony, do you have the Japanese Version? The deck monsters look idnetical, but I've been playing on Medium, and the names are slightly different.

Ex. Cheer Girls = Cheer Leaders, Review Team = Rookie Team, Yay Pixie = Yes Pixie, Prompter = Mastermind/Dark Lord, Invitation = Sweetness/Melting, Twinkle = Blink Moment, In Dream = Cont. Dream, Tough Man = Toughness, Rush = Sonic Rush, Item Lover = Item Lady, Space Clow = Space Tech. (I think), Funky Punch = Funky Dance/Funky Kick, Hot Glance = Hot Passion, Legend Start = Legend Again, Fine Dino = Heaven's Dino/Hell's Dino, Dog Lover = Dog Keeper/Dog Trainer, Oh Grace = Oh Elegant, Girl Logic = Girl Worry, 100 mi. Wall = 1k mi. Wall/10k mi. Wall, Power Wave = Big Wave/Great Wave, Iron Prince = Iron King/Iron Emperor...

Could you post some decks, Tony. I know that the different difficulty changes the decks, how much I am uncertain of, though.

By Tony on Friday, September 1, 2000 - 03:39 pm:

Well Eagle, That was a great idea, and I had just thought of doing that today, after getting started at Medium difficulty, and realizing a difference in some players decks. Unfortunately, I copied my Med. Level over my Easy level. I'm not too happy about that. It's the first time I did that on any MR game. I may go ahead and go back to Easy level, and lose some battles to get the Recipes. That's the only way I can see to get the decks. I'll work on it some this weekend, and wait a while on Medium level. I probably won't be able to get much done, but I am planning to take my Playstation to Kansas City next weekend. Will be gone for 2 weeks with no internet access (that REALLY sux), but lots of time in the evenings to play MRBC at the hotel!

By Tony on Friday, September 1, 2000 - 03:41 pm:

I should also clarify that in the column, Where to Find, that is where you meet them for practice battles. You actually meet some of the people in different places.
